result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Campbell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay  all costs, fees & surcharges by 06-23-16.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: to any sentence. Huber privileges. 
Court recommends against Electronic Monitoring. 
Report 06-26-15 by 4 p.m.
Failure to report will result in a Straight Time sentence.

Court will allow transfer to Waukesha.
If not accepted, the Court orders release to the Day Reporting Center.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never possess a firearm or body armor and his voting rights are suspended until his civil rights are restored.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J Campbell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: The Defendant's Motion or Request for release privileges/additional release privileges is denied.  Additional release privileges would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless, and frustrate the Court's specific Sentencing intent.  Signed, scanned and filed, sdg.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Carl Ashley, Br. 33, for review. jbs
Letter from defendant seeking release on electronic monitoring for remainder of sentence.
Letter from State Public Defender indicating that an attorney cannot be appointed because financial eligibility was not established.
COPY OF NOTICE OF INTENT, court record sheet and judgment of conviction forwarded to the State Public Defender's Office in Madison.pk
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael J Campbell in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Defendant has picked up a new case in Waukesha County.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence; Huber privileges. Court recommends against electronic monitoring. Report 6/26/2015 by 4pm.  Failure to report will result in a straight time sentence.  Court will allow transfer to Waukesha, if not accepted court orders release to the Day Reporting Center.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 6/23/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM WALWORTH COUNTY FOR PURPOSES OF THE SENTENCING IN BRANCH 6.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, Defendant Michael J Campbell not in court, in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the Walworth County Jail.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until  a Calendar Call / Sentencing. COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael J Campbell in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has a possible charge in Waukesha.  Per discussions, defense wished for the case to be read-in to this case, however Waukesha is wanting a different resolution.  Defendant needs to complete 40 hours of community service.  Documentation of treatment is needed and dates and results of test.  Review hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael J Campbell in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Brad Alan Vorpahl and Steven Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

CASE RECALLED.

State is communicating with the Waukesha county ADA to reach a resolution.  Defendant informs the court he is receiving medically assisted treatment, and testing negative and attending treatment.  Documentation is needed from the Healing Center.  Defendant has not begun community service.  Review hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael J Campbell in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Case was to be staffed.  Defense informs court defendant has a pending case in Waukesha and was not informed of the staffing date.  Case passed.

Defendant Michael J Campbell in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Defendant has picked up a new case in Waukesha County.   Defendant to reestablish contact with the Healing Center.  Case is adjourned for staffing.  Review hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael J Campbell in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is not consistent with attending counseling.  Defendant is testing negative and needs to completed community service.
  Review hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael J Campbell in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy clerk:  dn
.
Filed, signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  The court reviewed the Agreement with the defendant.  
The defendant was advised of his/her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry.
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and found it to be in the best interest of the parties and the general public.
Case adjourned to for review hearing in Branch 6 on January 13, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.

At the request of the parties, case is calendared on the Speedy Disposition Calendar on 10/10/2014 at 01:30 p.m. for a deferred prosecution agreement hearing.
cab

Defendant Michael J Campbell in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Hanna Kolberg.
Case scheduled for DPA hearing.  Defendant needs to find a monitoring agency.  Justice Point is full and not able to monitor the defendant.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 10/14/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court stated a DPA will not be approved if no montoring agency is found by the next court date.  aw  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael J Campbell in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  State has offered the defendant a DPA.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 8/27/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael J Campbell in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State may offer a DPA in this case.  Defendant to have TAD evaluation.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 7/15/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael J Campbell in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Nathaniel Adamson for Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael J Campbell in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Katryna L Childs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/21/14 @ 1:30pm
